meanings.sent1: The new software update made the computer bootable again.
meanings.sent2: The bootable USB drive contained all the necessary files.
meanings.sent3: The old laptop felt proud to be bootable once more.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like a bootable engine, always ready to start.
meanings.sent5: The idea sparked in his mind like a bootable light bulb.

meanings.definition: Able to start up a computer from a specified device
meanings.sent1: The bootable CD allowed the computer to start from scratch.
meanings.sent2: Make sure the external hard drive is bootable before inserting it.
meanings.sent3: The floppy disk joked that it was the most bootable of them all.
meanings.sent4: His voice acted as a bootable command, initiating the process effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The power button served as the bootable gateway to the digital world.
